turns.raw_header: You used the tag `!<q>` before your message. I don’t have built‑in knowledge of that specific syntax, but it looks like a custom or tool-specific marker—possibly meaning “quote,” “question,” or a formatting/command tag for another system.
turns.body:
Your actual content is just:

> test
turns.footer: If you’re experimenting: I’m receiving the text normally and can respond as usual. If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a special behavior, tell me what it should do (e.g., “treat everything after this as a quote” or “answer in a specific format”), and I’ll adapt my replies accordingly.

parsed_footer.raw: If you’re experimenting: I’m receiving the text normally and can respond as usual. If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a special behavior, tell me what it should do (e.g., “treat everything after this as a quote” or “answer in a specific format”), and I’ll adapt my replies accordingly.

turns.body:
> second test

Like `!<q>`, `!<o>` isn’t a built‑in control code for me, but I can treat it however you’d like. For example:

- If `!<o>` means “output only” or “no explanation,” I can keep answers very short.
- If it means something else in your setup, describe the intended behavior and I’ll follow it.
turns.footer: Right now I just see your message normally and can respond in the standard way.
